question_text: What's your objective? Select "Unknown" if you're not sure.
q_option_code: obj_inventory, obj_divers_rich, obj_occupancy, obj_rel_abund, obj_abundance, obj_pop_size, obj_density, obj_vital_rate, obj_behaviour, obj_unknown
q_option_label: Species inventory, Species diversity & richness, Occupancy, Relative abundance, Absolute abundance, Population size, Density, Vital rates, Behaviour, Unknown

question_text: Do you have a limited number of cameras?
Do you plan to strategically place camera locations to include multiple habitats or otherwise differing categories (e.g., different land cover types, or near vs. far from a disturbance)

If so, how many covariates?
(e.g., 5 different habitat types would be 5 covariates)
Is there a minimum number of months you can sample in total? If so, how many?
Is there a maximum number of months you can sample? If so, how many?
Do you wish to sample long enough to reach the species-accumulation asymptote?
Are you sampling for a single species or multiple?
How well is the biology about of the Target Species known?
q_option_label: Poorly known, Well known, I'm not sure

question_text: Is the distribution of the Target Species highly restricted?
If so, enter the home range diameter (in metres)
Is home range size information available for your Target Species (can be taken from the literature)?
What is the approximate size of the Target Species?
How rare or common is the Target Species?
q_option_code: common, less common, rare, very-rare, unkn, multiple
q_option_label: Common, Less common, Rare, Very rare, Unknown, Multiple

question_text: How detectable is the Target Species?
Will each camera location be treated as an independent sample?
